answers.author: Lori Grumet
answers.text:
I found a few plans on-line that are more or less in draft form.  url's for anyone else who may be interested in a Cultural Plan for your city might want to check out the following  http://www.edd.state.nm.us/artsCulture/meetDistricts/LasVegasACDCulturalPlan.pdf or http://www.edd.state.nm.us/artsCulture/meetDistricts/SilverCityACDCulturalPlan.pdf
www.ci.austin.tx.us/culturalplan/
www.tucsonpimaartscouncil.org/culturalplan/index.html

answers.author: Regan Carrizales
answers.text:
I also have a few that I ran across...2 are from Alliance Members
Clive, IA - www.clivepublicart.com.  Their master plan, current projects, pictures, artist registry information, blog, etc., can all be found there.   
Decatur, GA - RFP
http://www.decaturga.com/client_resources/cgs/citysvcs/rfp/rfp_cultureartsmasterplan.pdf
Austin, TX - Downtown Arts District plan-in-progress (includes process info)
http://www.ci.austin.tx.us/downtown/0407/downloads/12-14_dntn_arts.pdf
Birmingham, AL - Comprehensive Plan + Operating Plan
http://www.cultural-alliance.com/masterplan.html

author: Pamela Muse
text:
The City of Las Cruces, NM is interested in receiving copies of your Cultural Plans - meaning a structured, community-wide fact-finding and consensus-building process to assess community needs and to develop a plan of action that directs arts and cultural resources to address those needs.
Thank you,
Lori Grumet
Public Services Director
City of Las Cruces
(575) 528-3477
lgrumet@las-cruces.org
title: Developing Cultural Plan re: Arts & Cultural Resources
